intro.title: ABOUT PROGRAMMERS OF AMERICA 2024
intro.description:
The regional contests are partitioned into eight championships; the ICPC Africa & Arab Championship, the ICPC Asia East Championship, the ICPC Asia Pacific Championship, the ICPC Asia West Championship, the ICPC European Championship, the ICPC Latin America Championship, the ICPC Northern Eurasia Championship, and the ICPC North America Championship.  Additional Championships may be defined by the ICPC Executive Committee.
The highest level Regional Contest may be a Championship Contest. Team composition and requirements rules for a Championship contest are to be the same as for the World Finals. A Championship contest should be held no later than three months prior to the World Finals.
Note: The 2023/24 Regional Schedule may extend into the first quarter of 2024.

icpc.title: INTERNATIONAL COLLEGIATE PROGRAMMING CONTEST
icpc.description: ICPC organizes the algorithmic programming contest for university students, in teams of three, representing their university. They work to solve real-world problems, promoting collaboration, creativity, innovation, and the ability to perform under pressure. Through training and competition, teams challenge each other to push the boundaries of what is possible. Simply put, it is the oldest, largest, and most prestigious programming contest in the world.

rules.title: Promotion Rules
rules.sub: Promotion Rules to and from the Latin American ICPC Championship
rules.intro: Definition of rules for promoting teams from the ICPC Regional Contests in Latin America to the Latin American ICPC Championship, and from this championship to the World Finals.
rules.text1: The following guiding principles were considered:
rules.sec1list3: Level of participation in the regions: number of different schools.
rules.text2: The ICPC Latin America Super Region comprises the following six regions:
rules.text3: The Regional Contest maintains the format used in previous years:
rules.sec3list2: It occurs at a common (synchronized) date and time.
rules.sec3list3: Participating teams at each site receive the same problem set.
rules.sec3list4: Computers must use the official Maratona Linux version as their operating system.
rules.sec3list6: Results are aggregated at three levels: super-region, region, and country.
rules.text4: General rule: Up to two teams from the same institution can be promoted to the Championship.
rules.text5: Let N be the number of teams to be promoted to the Championship (40-60, always an even number).
rules.sec4list1: N/2 slots should be allocated to teams with the best performance in the Regional Contest, considering the General Rule.
rules.sec4list2: Countries that don't have qualified teams yet receive a slot. This slot is assigned to the team with the best performance in each country, but only if that team solves at least one problem in the Regional Contest. Otherwise, that country should not have any slot.
rules.sec4list3: If any of the host schools of the Championship doesn't have a promoted team, a slot will be assigned to the team with the best performance among the non-promoted schools.
rules.sec4list4: The remaining slots must be assigned to the regions using the algorithm shared at the end. Whenever a region receives a slot, it should be assigned to the team with the best performance in that region, considering the General Rule.
rules.text6: General rule: Only one team from a given institution can advance to the World Finals.
rules.text7: Let 'N_WF' be the number of World Finals slots assigned to Latin America. Considering the results in the Championship:
rules.sec5list1: The champion of each of the six regions receives a slot.
rules.sec5list2: The remaining slots are assigned to the NW_F - 6 teams with the best performance.
rules.text8: Only one team from a given institution can advance to the World Finals. Airfare to the World Finals will be covered for the promoted teams' contestants.
rules.text9: The team with the best performance in the Championship will be declared the Latin American Champion.
rules.text10: Unforeseen cases in these rules will be resolved by the Latin America Steering Committee, composed of the Regional Directors of the Conquest from the six ICPC regions and the Director of the ICPC Latin America Super Region.
rules.sec8: Algorithm for Assigning the Remaining Slots
rules.sec8list11: 'nSchools_Latam' be the total number of participating schools in the regionals,
rules.sec8list12: 'nSchools_R' be the number of schools in region R
rules.sec8list13: 'allocated' be the number of slots already assigned
rules.sec8list14: 'allocated_R' be the number of slots already assigned to region R
rules.sec8list15: 'fractions_R' be the fractions of the region from the previous year. In the first year, it's initialized to 0 for each region.
rules.sec8list222: Assign nslots_R slots to region R.
rules.sec8list225: Add (nSchools_R / slotsRatio) - trunc (nSchools_R / slotsRatio) to fractions_R.
rules.sec8list31: Assign a slot to the region with the highest fractions_R.
rules.sec8list4: In case of a tie in 3.1, all tied regions receive a slot, resulting in a total number of slots greater than N if that happens in the last iteration of 3.
rules.sec8list5: Fractions greater than zero must be carried over to the next year.
